title: KIOE
text:
KIOE (91.3 <a href="FM%20broadcasting">FM</a>) is a <a href="non-commercial%20educational">non-commercial educational</a> <a href="radio%20station">radio station</a> licensed to serve the <a href="city%20of%20license">community</a> of <a href="Utulei%2C%20American%20Samoa">Utulei</a>, a village on the island of <a href="Tutuila">Tutuila</a> in <a href="American%20Samoa">American Samoa</a>, since May 2011. The station's <a href="broadcast%20license">broadcast license</a> is held by Leone Church of Christ.
KIOE broadcasts a <a href="religious%20radio">religious radio</a> <a href="radio%20format">format</a>.
History.
In October 2007, Leone Church of Christ applied to the <a href="Federal%20Communications%20Commission">Federal Communications Commission</a> (FCC) for a <a href="construction%20permit">construction permit</a> for a new broadcast radio station. The FCC granted this permit on May 20, 2008, with a scheduled expiration date of May 20, 2011. The new station was assigned <a href="call%20sign">call sign</a> "KIOE" on May 18, 2011. After construction and testing were completed in May 2011, the station was granted its <a href="broadcast%20license">broadcast license</a> on May 24, 2011.
